intro: Chlorophytum ruahense, commonly known as the Ruahene spider plant, is a member of the Asparagaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, and thrives in warm, dry climates. The plant is characterized by its long, arching leaves that resemble spider legs, giving it its common name. It produces small, white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Chlorophytum ruahense is a low-maintenance plant that is well-suited for indoor cultivation.
